alert.note: Alert for Castro (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:18PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Castro County through 445 PM CDT... At 417 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Easter, or 6 miles north of Dimmitt, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Easter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
